Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Father Brian P. Dowd, St. Patrick’s Roman Catholic Church, located at 9511 Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11209.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Brannan.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Brian P. Dowd, St. Patrick’s Roman Catholic Church, located at 9511 Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11209.

Council Member Brannan moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution condemning the human trafficking of migrants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Condemning the human trafficking of migrants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to newsrack requirements and to repeal and replace subdivision a of section 19-128.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Newsrack Requirements

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the statute of limitations for commencing a private cause of action under the city human rights law
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Extending the statute of limitations for commencing a private cause of action under the city human rights law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to voiding no-rehire provisions in settlement agreements for persons aggrieved by unlawful discriminatory practices
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Voiding no-rehire provisions in settlement agreements for persons aggrieved by unlawful discriminatory practices.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to Pass, and the President to Sign, S. 4787/H.R. 8685, the “Afghan Adjustment Act,” which would provide a pathway to permanent legal status for evacuees from Afghanistan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Afghan Adjustment Act (S. 4787/H.R. 8685)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring a report indicating the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring a report indicating the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rules of construction for unspecified ranges of civil penalties
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Relation to the rules of construction for unspecified ranges of civil penalties.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business

Items.MatterName: Recognizing November 30 as Yerba Mate Day in the City of New York.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Suspending alternate side parking regulations on Tisha B’Av.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.5988, which would impose a fee on landlords who have residential dwelling units which remain vacant for an extended period of time.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Impose a fee on landlords who have residential dwelling units which remain vacant for an extended period of time. (A.5988)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S2856, a bill which relates to the appointment and qualifications of members of rent boards.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Relates to the appointment and qualifications of members of rent boards. (S. 2856)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

There were 49 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Tuesday, November 22, 2022.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Res. No. 362,  VOTE: 48-1-0
Negative: CM Yeger.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
